title.narrative: IR 2- ACCESS AND UTILIZATION OF EQUITABL

description.narrative: IR 2: Access and utilization of equitable health and nutrition services improved for women, adolescent girls and children., which contributes to Child Health, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 1: Improve the health and nutrition status of mothers, children and adolescents with focus on socially excluded and economically marginaliz ed groups through an equitable and participatory approach and by impleme nting high-impact cost effective proven interventions.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
